The 67th Infantry Battalion engaged in a firefight with the New People's Army (NPA) near Aliwagwag Falls Eco-Park, a tourist destination in Cateel area, Davao Oriental, on 23 Apr 2017. A soldier was wounded in the attack. The NPA reportedly suffered casualties but the number was not determined. The NPA also attacked facilities at the Eco-Park, causing damage.

The military clashed with suspected Maute Group militants at the Piagapo Complex, Piagapo, Lanao del Sur between 22 to 24 Apr 2017. As per government sources, at least 37 militants were killed during the three days of the operation (including four foreign fighters) and three soldiers were wounded. Fatalities divided among 3 events.

notes: Around 2000 farmers belonging to the Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP) and their supporters from other militant-backed farmers' groups staged a protest at Hacienda Luisita, Barangay Balete, Tarlac City in the evening of 23 Apr 2017 demonstrating the government's unfair allocation of lands following the agrarian reform. The protesters occupied a piece of land owned by the Rizal Commercial Banking Corp. (RCBC) for the purposes of the protest.

The military clashed with suspected Maute Group militants at the Piagapo Complex, Piagapo, Lanao del Sur between 22 to 24 Apr 2017, seizing a Maute camp in Sitio Pagalungan, Barangay Gacap, Piagapo. assoc_actor_1: KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; Farmers (Philippines)
notes: Around 3000 farmers belonging to the Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP) and their supporters from other militant-backed farmers' groups staged a protest at Hacienda Luisita, Barangay Balete, Tarlac City on 24 Apr 2017 demonstrating the government's unfair allocation of lands following the agrarian reform. The protesters occupied a piece of land owned by the Rizal Commercial Banking Corp. (RCBC) for the purposes of the protest and demolished a wall encircling the property on 24 Apr.

Militant farmers forcibly occupied the contested RCBC compound in Tarlac, Tarlac on April 24, after they petitioned then Agrarian Reform Secretary Rafael Mariano to use the 500-hectare property for agrarian land distribution.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Daily Inquirer

Fourteen people were wounded in a pipe bomb explosion near Quezon Boulevard in Quiapo, Manila, Metro Manila on 28 Apr 2017, around 3km away from the ASEAN summit. The perpetrator is unknown and the link to the ASEAN summit has been denied.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Marine Corps
notes: The Philippine marines clashed with the Abu Sayyaf in a remote location in Barangay Silangkan, Parang, Sulu on 28 Apr 2017. An Abu Sayyaf commander, was killed.

The New People's Army (NPA) attacked and vandalised Lapanday Foods Corp.'s (LFC) office compound and plants in Davao city, Davao del Sur on April 29 morning. A fisherman was injured when he stepped on an improvised explosive device planted by NPA to prevent law enforcers from pursuing them.

Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) burned and looted manufacturing plants of Lapanday Foods Corp. (Inc.) in Barangay Mandug, Buhangin, Davao del Sur on 29 Apr 2017. The reason for the attack is said to be linked to an agrarian dispute.

Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) raided Maconday Plastic Plant, Panabo City, Davao del Norte on 29 Apr 2017. The reason for the attack is said to be linked to an agrarian dispute. On the same day rebels also attacked and burnt down the Macondray Plastic Plant in the village of Tapore in Panabo City.

Two New People's Army (NPA) rebels were killed in a clash with private security personnel of a cattle ranch and banana plantation in Barangay Pangyan in Calinan, Davao City owned by a family at around 3 am on April 29.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Malay, Aklan on 29 Apr 2017.

The New People's Army (NPA) raided a police station in Barangay Poblacion Norte, Maddela, Quirino on 29 Apr 2017, killing one policeman. The rebels also kidnapped a Chief Inspector and 2 police officers, all of whom surfaced unharmed on 30 Apr 2017.
Major cooperatives staged a rally in La Trinidad town in Benguet province on April 29 to protest planned removal of tax exemptions and a directive to submit their members' credit histories.
Major cooperatives staged a rally in Baguio, Benguet city on April 29 to protest planned removal of tax exemptions and a directive to submit their members' credit histories.
